title: Today in history: Watch Lionel Messi play on his Barcelona derby
text:
20:25 CET Today in history: Watch Lionel Messi play on his Barcelona derby - www.allsports.com.gh 
Leo Messi has come a long, long way since his first team debut on October 16 of 2004. Here's an overview of facts and stats from Messi's first game for BarÃ§a's to some remarkable feats in his career. 
The Brazilian Deco scored the only goal of the derby with a shot from outside the area that was deflected by a defender before it went into Kameni's goal and later gave way to Lionel Messi on his Barcelona derby infront of over 30,000 fans at the MontjuÃ¯c. 
Number 30. Messi donned the number 30 on his back when he came in with 8 minutes to go before the end of the match. 
371 - The record amount of goals for Barcelona he set after a hat-trick against Almeria this season smashed Paulino Alcantara's previous record of 369. 
91 - The amount of goals he scored in 2012, a world record. 
82 - the minute that he was sprung from the bench against Espanyol on his debut. 
77 minutes - The amount of time that Messi played for the first team in his debut 2004/05 season. 
0:46 seconds - The duration of this lovely tribute from Vincent Enyeama ahead of his meeting with the Argentinian in the World Cup. Not quite Barcelona specific but still wonderful. 
30 - The number that Messi wore on his debut against Espanyol. 
25- How old Messi was when he became the youngest player to score 200 goals in La Liga matches. 
24 - The age that Messi became Barcelona's all-time top scorer in official club competitions. 
21 - The amount of goals he has scored against Real Madrid in his career so far. 
17 years, 3 months and 22 days - How old Messi was when he featured in his first match for Barcelona, he was the second-youngest player to ever don the Blaugrana colours for the first team. 
13 - The year that he first arrived at the Nou Camp, take a look at his I.D card. 
Messi Age10 - His iconic jersey and as a class gesture he sent a copy to Gerd Muller signed "with respect and admiration", after breaking his calendar year goal scoring record. 
Messi-1010 March, 2007 - Messi announces his incredible talent to the world with a stunning hat-trick against Real Madrid in an epic 3-3 Classico draw. 
9 - The age he was during this briliant anecdote from Guillem Balague's book about Messi, "On the Newells Old Boys pitch, the directors would ask him to do some keepy-uppies before the senior game or at half-time. On one occasion, in Mar del Plata, he did keepy-uppies before the game and fans would throw money at him. Fifteen minutes would go by and he still hadn't lost control of the ball. He was nine. 
7 and a half months - That's how long it took Messi to score his first official goal for Barcelona after making his debut. 
6 - La Liga titles won, the same amount of Getafe players that he beat to score this amazing goal. 
It's also the number of trophies that a Messi inspired Barcelona won during their grand slam 2007-08 season under Pep Guardiola. 
5ft 7'' - His height which hasn't stopped the Argentinian genius from making fools out of some of the world's best defenders. 
4 - Goals against Arsenal in this Champions League knock-out match. 
It's the same number of reserve team players that were called up by Frank Rijkaard to complete the bench for Messi's debut match against Espanyol. 
4 - The number of FIFA/Ballons d'Or's that he won consecutively. 
Messi-43 - Champions League winners medals.2 - Super Cups and Club World Cups.1 - Lionel Messi, the greatest player of his generation who signed for Barcelona on this napkin.
